translation.item: No hit points left. Repair your ship in the hangar or buy a new ship!
You're not logged in. Go to the homepage and log in to continue playing!

You can make a jump if your level allows it.
You can't use this portal: You need to have at least level %!
Unable to attack: You didn't select an opponent.

Repairs completed. Your spaceship now has 100% hit points.

Automatic weapons upgrade by activating lab CPU
Hide star chart automatically after jump
Show cargo boxes which are not free
Changes will take effect after the space map has been reloaded.
Let the journey to a galaxy far, far away begin.

Your spaceship is located in the center of the space map. Click on the map to move your ship around space and fly by holding down your mouse button. Use the mini map on the bottom right to travel long distances. The crosshairs on the mini map show your spaceship's location in the universe.
Click on LASERS or ROCKETS to fire your weapons at enemies.
Here are some useful tips to help you on your space odyssey:
1. Your ship is currently located in the demilitarized zone surrounding your space station.
2. Collect raw materials in space and exchange them at your space station for credits.
3. Be careful not to attack ships from your own company.
4. Collect experience points by shooting down aliens and enemy ships.
You're connected to the game server.
Jumping is only possible 15 seconds after re-login.
Special ship - can't attack and can't be attacked
Game server will restart in %! minutes.
Game server will restart in %! seconds.
Your cargo box was stolen by: %!
Attack protection was lifted - time for you to fight!
%! minutes until relocation to the semi-final map.
Your ship doesn't have any laser cannons. That's why you can't attack.
You found the following special item: %!
For the next level-up, you need %! EP.
Automatic restocking purchase of ammunition failed - not enough credit
Automatic ammo purchase with Ammunition CPU
Jump not possible - you're in the middle of a battle.
Jump not possible - last battle was less than 20 seconds ago.

Jump not possible! You can't escape from a battle map when you're fighting in a battle.

You reached level %!. Please complete registration so that you can continue playing with your spaceship.

You can launch the next mine in %! seconds.

Sorry, there aren't enough players available. Your team will be removed from the map. Your group constellation will remain until your next round.
Your team lost the round with %COUNT% survivors.
You'll be removed from the map.
Draw: Both teams lose and will be removed from the map.
Repair your ship and prepare for the next round.
Visit the Hall of Fame to view the Team Deathmatch results and statistics.
We're keeping track of your time.

Congratulations!
You've completed the tutorial and are now a full-fledged member of the %faction%. Embark on your outer space journey and discover the far reaches of the DarkOrbit universe.
Have a blast!
Don't destroy more than %count% ships from other players
You were hit by a hologram-emitter rocket. Your ship's appearance has now been temporarily altered.
The hologram emitter has lost its effect: Your ship looks normal again.
Don't destroy any ships from other players
Don't destroy more than one ship from other players
Don't destroy more than one enemy %types% ship
Don't destroy more than one %faction% ship
Don't destroy more than one %faction% %types% ship

Welcome to DarkOrbit's Open %VERSION%!
Help us find the errors and bugs in this test version before the final version goes live.
Report any errors you find in the game in the forum:
%BOARD_LINK%
You'll also find a detailed description of how to create a good bug report there. It'll help us get the job done quicker! Please remember that there is no e-mail support for this test environment. That's why you'll have to clarify all problems and questions in the Beta forum.
We reserve the right to close the test server or reset accounts at any time.
Have a blast testing,
Your DarkOrbit Team
For a limited time only - special boosters available in the shop now!
Happy Hour! Now's the time to get your Uridium at a bargain price!
Mega happy hour! Now's the time to get your Uridium at a bargain price!
Your fellow space pilot %NICKNAME% captured the %COMPANY% beacon!
Your base is missing the %COMPANY% beacon!
%NICKNAME% (%COMPANY_1%) brought the %COMPANY_2% beacon into the target zone.

Outside our star system. Unable to locate position ...

You can't jump to this map with the beacon.

What you take is what you get
Drag 'n drop to easily upgrade your items: Just drag the resource over the desired item!
Upgrading with this resource will result in the loss of any other recently completed upgrades.
Prometium is the red raw material which can be collected in outer space.
Endurium is the blue raw material which can be collected in outer space.
Terbium is the gold raw material which can be collected in outer space.
You need Xenomit to produce Promerium.
Click on the Xenomit image to purchase it in the trading post.
How much do you want to produce?
Start and stop attacks using the shortcut bar

The shortcut bar has 10 opens slots. You can drag & drop items into these slots to use them as shortcut buttons. The buttons are all numbered. Just press on that number on your keyboard to use the slot item.

The inventory bar has up to three levels. The 5 hexagons in the top level are permanent. They represent lasers, rockets, special ammo, CPUs and the “Buy now” function. If you click on one of these five hexagons, a second level and possibly a third level will open. The bars in the second-level icons change color depending on how much of each item you have in stock. Blue represents a healthy supply, red means less and gray means none. The third-level icons can all be used to start an attack with the relevant weapon type, and can also be used to stop laser attacks only.
The log window is your logbook history. It shows all DO activities such as recent announcements, kills, countdowns, etc. You can resize it using the pentagon symbol on the bottom right.

The mini map is your panoramic view of the entire space map. The cross-axis shows your current coordinates and the danger bar on the left-hand side changes color and size to indicate your level of danger.
The star system helps you find your way in the endless expanse of space. It shows how the different maps are connected and how you can travel between them.

The ship window displays all important ship information such as HP, nanohull strength, cargo bay capacity, rockets, ammo and current configs. Click on the information to switch between graphical and digital displays.
The user window shows all important account information such as EP, level, honor, credits, Uridium and Jackpot balance.

Versus system is new thing only on our server! It let you challange anyone on server for fair 1vs1 battle. Once an challange is send, will be accepted by enemy, you will be moved to special map for this mode!
Do you really want to reset your settings? Warning: If you accept, your browser window will close and you'll have to re-launch the game.
You still have one %MULTI% to use!
1 minute remaining until Mega Happy Hour ends
%MINS% minutes remaining until Mega Happy Hour ends
%SECS% seconds remaining until Mega Happy Hour ends
%TIME% remaining until Mega Happy Hour ends
1 minute remaining until Happy Hour ends
%MINS% minutes remaining until Happy Hour ends
%SECS% seconds remaining until Happy Hour ends
%DAYS% day(s) remaining for your 50% EP booster.
%HOURS% hour(s) remaining for your 50% EP booster.
You can't attack any players on a base map!
Targeting device compromised by enemy EMP burst!

We're under attack in an outlying sector! Come to our rescue.

Follow the flashing arrow: Left-click the location to which your ship should fly.
Over and out!

Nice work, space pilot! Remember to repair your ship after being hit by enemy fire.

To repair it, just press [3] or click the repair bot button in the shortcut bar.

Note: Robots will stop repairing your ship as soon the ship moves.

Do you see those glowing orange boxes? They contain valuable resources.

Click on them to collect them.

Find out what's inside them at the top of the screen or in your logbook.

Well done, pilot! Destroy enemies in space to get money and resources.

This will increase your experience and honor points, allowing you to enter new galaxies and maps.

Escort your ally's damaged ship to the space station so that it can be repaired.

Contact the ship by flying close to it.

Thanks for your help! Unfortunately, I lost my cargo. You'll find 3 Prometium, 2 Endurium and 1 Terbium not far from here.

Could you get them for me? Just click on the items and wait until they've been beamed aboard.

All right, backup is finally here.

Follow us to the jump portal so we can fly back to the station and have my ship repaired.

This is the jump portal that takes you to other maps.

Press [J] or click on the circle symbol on the upper right to fly through the gate.

Quick, destroy the three rival ships!

Left-click them to target in on the ships.

Launch your attack with the [1] key or the laser button in the shortcut bar.
Kill opponents quicker with <blue>rockets</blue>. Fire off rockets with the <blue>[2]</blue> key or the <blue>rocket button in the shortcut bar</blue>.
Use this setting carefully. When the game is loaded, you will be automatically logged into the client, and other pilots will be able to attack you immediately.

Safe at last! You can keep the resources.

Sell them at the station by clicking on the Trade button on the top right.

Take a look around the hangar. You can buy new ships and weapons there.

You're on your own from now on, but you're a capable space pilot, and I'm sure you won't have any problems.

Thanks again, and good luck! Over and out.
C'mon, move it. We've got to get to the station quickly so I can repair my ship.
Did you like this item? Click here to buy a second one for a special price!
Explore your base and win a new ship!
Click in the orbit to navigate to a certain point and explore your home base.
Use your laser (1 key) and your rockets (2 key) to destroy a Streuner.
Collect 5 of the glowing orange boxes by clicking on them. You can find them on all maps.
Reach level 2 by shooting down enough aliens to collect 10,000 experience points.
Destroy more aliens using your laser (1 key) and your rockets (2 key) or complete a few quests to collect enough experience points to reach level 2.
Collect ten pieces of red ore that can be found on all maps.
Fly to the space station shown on the mini map and click on the button with the arrows in the top-right corner of your screen to sell your cargo in the trade window.
Jump to the second map in your system.
Fly to the jump portal that looks like a white ring on the mini map by pressing the [J] key or clicking on the yellow button with the circular symbol in the top-right corner of your game window.
Destroy a Lordakia on your system's second map. But be careful! You only have newbie protection on the first map.
Upgrade your speed or shield generator with Promerium.

First conclude the Lordakia quest, then click on the button in the top-right corner that looks like a rocket with a plus sign. Click on the upgrade tab at the top of the pop-up and drag the Promerium (light orange ore) to one of your generators.
Use the "Buy now" function to get more rockets or laser ammo.

Click on the yellow C-shaped pipe icon at the bottom of your screen in the shortcut bar to open the "Buy now" menu. Select the laser ammo or rockets of your choice. When the pipe icon underneath your selection looks like a C, you can pay for the item you chose in credits. When the pipe icon looks like a U, you must pay in Uridium. Tip: You may have to use up some ammo or rockets before you can buy more.
Accept a quest on the DarkOrbit website and complete it.
Click on the button with the star symbol to open the quest window. Open the "Jobs" page, accept a quest and complete it.
Invite another player to join your outfit, or get another player to invite you into theirs.

Click on the button with the three small figures to invite another player to join your outfit. Click on a player to select them and then on the letter symbol in the outfit pop-up to invite them. The other player must accept your invitation. Tip: If none of the players you invite accept, use the chat to search for a player who'll help you.

Jump portals serve as gates to other galaxies. To use one, fly up to it and press [J].

CAUTION: The deeper into DarkOrbit you fly, the stronger your enemies will be.
Your cargo bay is full: Fly back to the station to sell your cargo. Once you get to the station, click on "Trade raw materials" in the top-right corner of your game window to open the trade menu.
Exclusive item: Only available while supplies last!
Test it out for 3 days - No obligation!

Headquarters to Delta squad:
Your mission is to infiltrate the pirate galaxy, collect intel and and destroy the enemy by taking out the pirate leader, known as Century Falcon. Do you copy?

I'll keep you up to date on enemy positions.
Remember to watch your six - you're in enemy space now.
Good luck ... you're gonna need it.
Over and out!
Nice work! According to our intel, the facility provided power to pirate headquarters before it was shut down.
Use your laser cannons on it - maybe the laser energy will bring the facility back online.

Great job! The power station's operational again.
The scout drones are reporting an extra energy signature.
The power station must have been linked to their HQ. When we reactivated the power station, it triggered the HQ repair zone.
Fly into the zone and repair your ships.
Their HQ's running on auxiliary power. They must have interrupted the power supply to turn off life support and keep us out.

Activate the other power stations to increase the power supply.
Prepare yourselves: Once the HQ is operational, Century Falcon will know we've penetrated his defenses and attack us.
Get ready for the battle of a lifetime!

Our intel was accurate - the pirates were defending the power stations to prevent us from activating HQ.
Find and activate all their power stations!

Top notch! The extra power reactivated the HQ and Century Falcon's come out of hiding to defend it.
This is it, destroy Century Falcon and the operation will be complete.

Operation Charlie Foxtrot successful!
That was some fine flying! You've earned yourselves some downtime.
Over and out!
You must be part of an outfit to jump to this map.
No instance found - Creating instance for outfit leader ...
Instance found - Beaming players to the instance ...
Outfit leader must create an instance before you can jump to the map.
Not enough players on the map - All players will be returned and the instance canceled.

Thanks for your loyalty. We've put together some great packs for you. Get one now on the game's Uridium page!

Visit the game's Uridium page and get a great deal today. This offer expires in 1 day!

Your game performance is suboptimal.

To improve your game performance, you can adjust the quality of the graphics to your computer in the display settings.
Preloaded ships use more memory, but attacks will happen quicker in the game.
The advanced mode allows you to individually adapt the settings to your needs.
The standard mode simplifies the setting options and uses predefined parameters.
Select between simplified and detailed ship designs.
Select between simplified and detailed engine animations.
Determine the extent to which damage and destruction animations are shown.
Select between simplified and detailed resources and boxes.
Define the quality of the background details
Select between simplified and detailed zones.
Exchange %VALUE_INPUT% Palladium for %VALUE_OUTPUT% units of energy.
Fly to the pirate's headquarters to exchange Palladium for extra energy.
Jump portal is out of order.
In exchange for %VALUE_INPUT% Palladium, you'll get %VALUE_OUTPUT% units of extra energy.
A booty key is required to collect.

There are two hot keys to make using your P.E.T. easier and more effective.

Activate and deactivate your P.E.T. with the [E] key and
switch to guard mode with the [R] key.
You found a high-score gate activator. You can now jump through the high-score gate.
You completed the high-score gate with %SCORE% points and will now be sent to your home map.
You do not have an activator - let your P.E.T. collect P.E.T. boxes to find one.
This box can only be collected by a P.E.T.
Warning pilots! The radiation zone is expanding. It's time for the final battle!
You found a component of the Apis drone blueprints. The immediate production price for this drone is now lower.
Unfortunately you failed the security check!
The captcha code was correctly entered. In return, here's a bonus box doubler for the next box you collect.
The captcha code was incorrectly entered. Please try entering it again in order to continue collecting boxes.
Please enter the captcha code in order to continue collecting boxes.
Welcome to reality, space pilot! Up until now, we've taken it easy on you. But now it's time. In orbit, there are tramps and scoundrels everywhere. They have you in their sights. They know no mercy!

Therefore, for the next two weeks we are admitting you to the company-wide pilot protection program and will provide you access to all premium advantages free of charge... enjoy the privileges!

Free repairs, time advantages and automatic helpers: use the advantages, because two weeks are quickly over
Your starter premium ends in: %COUNT% day(s).. Renew your Premium membership on the Uridium page at a special price!
Your starter premium is valid for: 1 day. Renew your Premium membership on the Uridium page at a special price!
Your starter premium ends in: %COUNT% day(s).
You have found a component of the Zeus blueprints. The immediate production price for this drone is now lower.
Did you like this item? Then click here to buy a second one for a special price!
Explore your base and win a new ship!
Navigate around the orbit by clicking your mouse. Your ship will follow so you can explore your home base!
Use your laser (1 key) and your rockets (2 key) to destroy a Streuner.
Collect 5 of the glowing orange boxes by clicking on them. You can find them on all maps.
Reach level 2 by shooting down enough aliens to collect 10,000 experience points.
Destroy more aliens using your laser (1 key) and your rockets (2 key) or complete a few quests to collect enough experience points to reach level 2.
Collect 10 pieces of the red ore that can be found on the map.
Fly to the space station clearly shown on the mini map and click on the button with the two arrows in the top-right corner of your screen to sell your cargo in the trade window.
Jump to the second star chart in your system.
Fly to the jump portal that looks like a white ring on the mini map and then press on the [J] key or click on the yellow button with the circular symbol in the top-right corner of your game window.
Destroy a Lordakia on your star system's second map. But be careful! You only have newbie protection on the first map.
Upgrade your speed or shield generator with Promerium!

First conclude the Lordakia quest, then click on the button in the top-right corner that looks like a rocket with a plus sign. Click on the upgrade tab at the top of the pop-up and drag the Promerium (orange-yellow ore) to one of your generators.
Use the "Buy now" function to get more rockets or laser ammo.

Click on the yellow C-shaped icon at the bottom of your screen in the shortcut bar to open the "Buy now" menu. Select the laser ammo or rockets of your choice. When the icon underneath your selection looks like a C, the item can be purchased for the price shown in credits. When it looks like a U, the price is shown in Uridium. Tip: You may have to use up some ammo or rockets before you can buy more.
Accept a quest on the website and complete it.
Click on the button with the star symbol to open the quest window, which is located on the right-hand side (if the window isn't already open). Open the "Jobs" page, accept a quest and complete it.
Invite another player to join your outfit, or get another player to invite you into theirs.

Click on the button with the three small figures to invite another player to join your outfit. Click on a player to select them and then on the letter symbol in the outfit pop-up to invite them. The other player must accept your invitation. Tip: If none of the players you invite accept, use the chat to search for a player who'll help you.
Scoremageddon target destroyed: you will receive %SCORE% points.
The opponent's level is too low. He did not participate in the Scoremageddon and therefore there are no points.
Your opponent was eliminated during Scoremageddon and therefore there are no points.

Kamikaze gear may not be used in this map.
Your ship doesn't have any laser cannons. That's why you can't attack.
Rocket type cannot be used without equiping a rocket launcher!
Repair your ship to continue playing!
Repair your ship at the nearest home base.
Replace your ship with a free Phoenix.
A stroke of luck: this repair is free! Your ship was destroyed during a time in which repairs are free.
Your ship was destroyed on a Galaxy Gate map, which offers free repairs.
A stroke of luck: this repair is free! Your ship was destroyed while the CTB beacon was on board.
Your ship was destroyed on a Jackpot Battle map, which offers free repairs.
As a Premium member, you can always repair your ship for free.
This ship design can always be repaired for free.
This repair is free because you lost one of your lives from Scoremageddon.
Your ship was destroyed at a free-repair event.
Your ship was destroyed on a map which offers free repairs.
This repair will cost you %COUNT% Uridium.
You do not have enough Uridium to repair your ship. Go to Payment to buy more Uridium or continue playing with the "Free Phoenix."
Use one of your %COUNT% repair credits.
This repair is free because your ship was destroyed on a battle map during the Spaceball Event.
Standard Formation No bonuses or mali.
Turtle Formation Increases shield power by 10%, but reduces laser and rocket damage by 7.5%.
Arrow Formation Increases rocket damage by 20%, but reduces laser damage by 3%.
Lance Formation Increases mine damage by 50%.
Star Formation Increases rocket damage by 25%, but also increases rocket launcher reload time by 33%.
Pincer Formation Increases laser damage by 3% against other players and provides an additional 5% honor point bonus. However, it reduces shield penetration by 10%.
Double Arrow Formation Increases shield penetration by 10%, but reduces shield power by 20%.
Diamond Formation Your shield regenerates 1% of your max shield power per second, up to a maximum of 5,000 per second. But hit points are reduced by 30%.
Chevron Formation Increases rocket damage by 50%, but ship hit points will be reduced by 20%.
Moth Formation Increases shield penetration by 20%. Increases hit points by 20%, as well. But weakens your shield strength at a rate of 1% per second.
Crab Formation Increases your shield absorption by 20%, but reduces your speed by 20%, as well.
Heart Formation Increases you shield power by 10% and your hit points by 20%. Reduces, however, laser damage by 5%.
Barrage Formation It causes 5% more laser damage to NPCs and also gives you 5% more EP. Shield absorption, however, will be reduced by 15%.
You need at least %COUNT% drones to use this formation!
Repair your ship at the next jumpgate in the DMZ. Careful, there are no NAZs on battle maps.

Repair your ship on the spot with 10% of your base hitpoints. After the repairs are complete, your ship will be protected by an Insta-shield for 10 seconds. Warning: The attack protection expires as soon as you attack someone else.
You can pay an additional %COUNT% U. to make repairs at the next jumpgate.
You can pay an additional %COUNT% U. to make on-the-spot repairs.
Caution! After logging out, the repair options "next jumpgate" and "on the spot" are no longer available.
Caution! After logging out or changing ships, the "next jumpgate" and "on the spot" repair options are no longer available.
Automatic CPU Fuel Assistant FB-X (automatically purchases P.E.T. fuel)
The Automatic CPU Fuel Assistant has purchased 10,000 units of P.E.T. fuel.
Targeting device compromised by enemy EMP burst!
Your ship was compromised by the Draw Fire effect.
Your ship was compromised by the JAMX effect.
HP repair gradually restores your ship's HP as well as the HP of selected ships.
Shield repair gradually restores your ship's shields as well as the shields of selected ships.
Repair Pod creates an energy field and repairs your ship as well as fellow outfit ships.
Draw Fire temporarily redirects the trajectory of nearby enemy fire towards your ship.
Travel Mode briefly increases your ship's speed, so you can quickly travel long distances.
Fortify bolsters your ship with protective armor and reduces its resistance to damage. It will however immobilize your ship.
Protection deploys a protective shield around your ship and redirects a portion of the damage inflicted on all nearby outfit members to your ship.
Ultimate Cloaking This ability cloaks your ship, immediately removes you from the mini map and stops others from making you the target.
JAMX emits an interference field which paralyzes enemy ships' functions. All effects which they are currently using will be compromised.
Target Marking It marks all targets for your outfit (even on the mini map) and increases the damage caused by all outfit members.
Recon This skill doubles your recon range on the mini map.
Warp not allowed on this map.
No warping while engaged in combat!
A commando squad has just been spotted on map %MAP%. Blow it's cover and destroy it!
Commando squads have just been spotted on maps %MAPS%. Blow their cover and destroy them!
You effectively blew the commando squad's cover and destroyed it!
You failed to destroy the commando squad and thus let them escape.
Provides current info on the infiltration defenses.
Some quality settings will be temporarily reduced when the CPU load is too high. When this load is reduced, the quality settings will be increased to the previously specified levels.
When activated, ships will slowly move up and down while idling.
Cannot warp. You do not have a flight-ready ship.
This setting activates / deactivates the premium quickslot bar. Warning: The keyboard settings will not be active when the premium quickslot bar is deactivated.

The PET window provides you with an overview of your PET. The bar displays important information - its hit points, amount of fuel, shield stats and experience. Activate the PET by using the Play button. You can refill it next to it and on the right you may select and activate the gear.
This warp costs one jump credit.
This warp will cost %COUNT% jump credits.
You only have 1 jump credit remaining.
This warp is free, because you are at the station.

Thanks for the help, Pilot!
You're new, aren't you?
You should probably introduce yourself to Nyx, then. She'll give you a few beginner missions and you could win amazing equipment and weapons.
She'll be waiting for you at the next station. Over and out.
You can only plant one mine per position.
You have requested to complete an action too soon after the last action. Please try again.
Only works with a premium pack.
Word puzzle is complete. You have received a capsule.
A capsule for the lottery has been booked to your account. As soon as you've collected the next letter, the puzzle starts over again.

Collect cargo boxes from the Hitac minions. With a little luck, you'll find some of the letters you need. When you solve the word puzzle, you'll receive a capsule that you can trade in for a lottery ticket on the Uridium page. Solve the puzzle as often as you'd like.
You received a capsule for the lottery!

Bat Formation Increases the damage you cause to NPCs by 8% and earns you 8% more XP, as well. Decreases your speed by 15%.
The installation of this Module has been cancelled.
You can only jump from a portal.
Immediate repairs on your home base only.
You can only trade raw materials on your home base.
You can pay an extra %COUNT% %CURRENCY% to be able to repair at the next jumpgate.
You can pay an extra %COUNT% %CURRENCY% to repair on the spot.
You don't have enough credits to repair your ship, but you can keep playing with the "Free Phoenix."
DarkOrbit's 6th birthday Thank you for your continued support!

Space Pilot!
Glad to see a friendly face - listen I got trapped here and could need your help!

Yeah, before you ask, I really don't know how I ended up in here.
Just jumped through that gate that came out of nowhere and here I am ...

... my cargo room is half empty, ship's severely damaged and most of
... wait, what is that?!
Watch out!!
Well this is more annoying than dangerous but <blue>I think I can help you </blue> - just need a little time setting things up ...
Well there you are again - thought these Streuners would have driven you off.
Remember that I lost most of my cargo? Actually I still have limited <blue>control over some boosters</blue> I just bought recently.

Let's see if we can put them to some use. Don't expect and be sure to <blue>stay close to the booster</blue> - and check the <blue>booster interface</blue> in your ship's computer - prepare for another wave of enemies!

OK <blue>activating booster 1.</blue> Now - this should give you some <blue>extra damage</blue> for a brief amount of time. I will send the booster's <blue>coordinates to your navigation system.</blue>
Worked like a charm, didn't it? I will reroute energy to the <blue>second booster</blue> now, this will increase your <blue>shield regeneration rate.</blue> Stay sharp!
Hey bud, welcome back! I figured out how to implement a series circuit that activates boosters more rapidly. <blue>Health-regeneration and hitpoints</blue> will be boosted.
Good you made it back. I've been tinkering around a bit in your absence - you might need to move to get all the advantages, though. Good Luck.
You are quite a pilot! I developed some activation patterns, which should help you a lot.
Damn, these things are starting to scare me. Being trapped in here feels like living in a goldfish bowl! Oh, and here they come again!
This will be a hard wave ... be sure to use the <blue>boosters,</blue> mate.
Hey, welcome back! Just wondering if you believe in all these "end of the world" rumors that have been spreading recently? Oh, here we go again!
Hi, buddy! Say, don't I know you from somewhere? You seem kind of familiar ... INCOMING!
Ok ... once again, I've improved the booster activation patterns. Check it out and give me some feedback ... I just might be on to something here!
What the <blue>frack</blue> is this thing? I'll try to power up the <blue>boosters</blue> as long as I can - make the best out of it. Good Luck!

My friend, it has been an <blue>honor</blue> fighting with you. I will reroute <blue>all remaining energy</blue> to keep the <blue>boosters</blue> going. Should <blue>life support fail</blue> before you've brought this wave down, please try to <blue>get me out of here.</blue> Farewell.

Sector Control is a company-based event that requires players to be a level 8 or higher. You cannot participate yet.

Free repairs on the active Hades Gate server.
If you log out or run out of time, you will be removed from this Hades Gate server.

You and this player are not at the same Hades Gate stage.
Build the Hades Gate to help this player defeat the Emperors.
You and this player are at the same Hades Gate stage.
Attack canceled. It's not possible to attack other pilots when in the Hades Gate.
Access denied - you must be in a group to enter the Hades Gate.
Access denied - you must be at the same stage as the group leader.
Hades Gate server is at maximum capacity. Consider joining or creating a new group.
Activation canceled – all group members must remain in the activation zone to start the gate.
Access denied - Your group already completed the Hades Gate.
Glad you made it. Amongst the usual alien chatter, I've picked up three unusually complex signals.
I think they originated from the Aliosi Sector. It looks like the aliens' leaders are planning something...
Only one way to find out for sure - destroy the alien waves, draw out their leaders, then do your companies proud and vaporize them!
Your unevolved skeletons and monkey brains make me want to puke.
The sooner we wipe your stench from the galaxy the better!
How dare you intrude on the inaugural Annihilation of Humanity Conference!
I, Emperor of the mighty Lordakium, will not stand for this insolence! Prepare to die!
We have observed your continuous wars and inability to live peacefully.
Tolerating your existence would be illogical ...

Fly to the activation zone marked on your minimap. This will trigger a subsonic frequency designed to draw the aliens out from the Nebula. Heads up: You'll need a complete group with at least 4 pilots to get started. If there are additional allies in the area, all will need to go into battle.
First-rate work, pilot! Your exploits are becoming a thing of legend. Watch your back...the alien leaders are already planning their next attack!
That'll teach them not to underestimate us. Well done, pilot!
Shoot down enemies at will until your honor is no longer in the red.
